alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Essex; King William; King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 7:25PM EDT until September 07 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern King and Queen County in east central Virginia... Southeastern Caroline County in north central Virginia... Northwestern King William County in east central Virginia... West central Essex County in east central Virginia... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 725 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Beulahville, or near Saint Stephens Church, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Beulahville around 730 PM EDT. Newtown around 735 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Beazley, Central Garage, Owenton, Hustle, Elevon, Upshaw, Central Point, Rexburg, Epworth, and Biscoe. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Essex; King William; King and Queen
